text.0: in the beginning rose hiranyagarbha born only lord of all created beings.
text.1: he fixed and holdeth up this earth and heaven what god shall we adore with our oblation.
text.2: giver of vital breath of power and vigour he whose commandments all the gods acknowledge.
text.3: the lord of death whose shade is life immortal what god shall we adore with our oblation.
text.4: who by his grandeur hath become sole ruler of all the moving world that breathes and slumbers.
text.5: he who is loord of men and lord of cattle what god shall we adore with our oblation.
text.6: his through his might are these snowcovered mountains and men call sea and rasā his possession.
text.7: his arms are these his are these heavenly regions what god shall we adore with our oblation.
text.8: by him the heavens are strong and earth is stedfast by him lights realm and skyvault are supported.
text.9: by him the regions in midair were measured what god shall we adore with our oblation.
text.10: to him supported by his help two armies embattled look while trembling in their spirit.
text.11: when over them the risen sun is shining what god shall we adore with our oblation.
text.12: what time the mighty waters came containing the universal germ producing agni.
text.13: thence sprang the gods one spirit into being what god shall we adore with our oblation.
text.14: he in his might surveyed the floods containing productive force and generating worship.
text.15: he is the god of gods and none beside him what god shall we adore with our oblation.
text.16: neer may he harm us who is earths begetter nor he whose laws are sure the heavens creator.
text.17: he who brought forth the great and lucid waters what god shall we adore with our oblation.
text.18: prajāpati thou only comprehendest all these created things and none beside thee.
text.19: grant us our hearts desire when we invoke thee may we have store of riches in possession.
